Alfin Lestaluhu Meninggal, Athallah: Indonesia Bangga, Fin!
01 Nov 2019, 05:32 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Salah satu bek andalan Timnas U-16, Alfin Lestaluhu, meninggal pada Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019. Rekan setimnya di Timnas U-16, Ahmad Athallah Araihan, menyampaikan rasa dukanya.
"Allah sayang Ose, Allah mau denger Ose azan. Semua sayang adik ee. Semoga tenang adik. Al-Fatihah," tulis Athallah Araihan melalui akun Instagramnya, Jumat, 1 Novemeber 2019.
Athallah mengaku mendapat banyak pelajaran selama bersama Alfin. Ia juga menyebutkan pelatih Timnas U-16, Bima Sakti, salut dengan sikap Alfin di dalam lapangan.
"Banyak pelajaran yang beta dapet dari kamu, respect. Orang lain jahat ke kamu, kamu balas dengan senyum. Orang lain meremehkan kamu, kamu balas dengan permainanmu," kata dia.
Athallah juga menyinggung mengenai perjuangan Alfin Lestaluhu yang telah ikut meloloskan Timnas U-16 ke Piala AFC U-16 2020 di Bahrain. "Jatuh bangun buat indonesia. Indonesia bangga, Fin, semua bangga," kata dia.
Saat Alfin dirawat di rumah sakit, rombongan Tim Nasional Indonesia U-16 menghadiri acara charity match yang digelar Asosiasi pemain profesional Indonesia untuk Alfin pada 27 Oktober 2019. Acara itu digelar di Lapangan Serenia Hills, Jakarta Selatan. Pelatih Timnas U-16, Bima Sakti didampingi para asistennya juga turut hadir dan bermain di laga eksebisi yang menampilkan APPI melawan HIPMI Jaya FC.
"Ya ini sebuah kepedulian terhadap sesama pemain. Apalagi Alfin pernah berjuang bersama kami di kualifikasi Piala AFC U-16 beberapa waktu lalu di Jakarta. Kami berharap Alfin segera sembuh serta cepat fit dan dapat bergabung bersama kami," kata Bima Sakti.
Pada laga amal itu beberapa pemain mantan Timnas Indonesia juga hadir seperti Kurniawan Dwi Yulianto, Nova Arianto, Hendro Kartiko, Syamsir Alam dll. Adapun sumbangan tersebut langsung diterima orang tua Alfin yang hadir pada acara ini.
Alfin Lestaluhu menjadi salah satu andalan timnas U-16 yang dilatih Bima Sakti. Saat tampil di Piala AFF U-15 2019, tim ini meraih peringkat ketiga.
Pesepak bola jebolan Sekolah Khusus Olahraga Ragunan itu kemudian tampil di laga Grup G Kualifikasi Piala Asia U-16 2020 yang berlangsung di Jakarta, pertengahan September 2019. Dia mencetak satu gol saat Indonesia mengalahkan Filipina 4-0 pada laga pertama. Indonesia pun lolos ke Piala Asia U-16 2020 di Bahrain.
Alfin Lestaluhu diketahui menderita sakit setelah dia dan keluarganya menjadi korban gempa yang mengguncang Pulau Ambon sekitarnya pada Kamis, 26 September lalu. Alfin sempat berada di tenda pengungsian sebelum dirawat di Rumah Sakit Tentara Ambon, Maluku, dan kemudian dibawa ke Jakarta untuk penanganan lebih lanjut.

IRSYAN HASYIM
text:
Alfin Lestaluhu Died, Athallah: Indonesia is Proud, Fin!
01 Nov 2019, 05:32 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - One of the mainstays of the U-16 national team defender, Alfin Lestaluhu, died on Thursday, October 31, 2019. His team-mate in the U-16 national team, Ahmad Athallah Araihan, expressed his grief.
"Allah loves Ose, Allah wants to listen to Ozan azan. All dear sister ee. Hopefully calm down sister. Al-Fatihah," Athallah Araihan wrote through his Instagram account, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Athallah claimed to have learned a lot while with Alfin. He also mentioned the U-16 national team coach, the Milky Way, applauded Alfin's attitude in the field.
"Many lessons can get from you beta, respect. Other people are evil to you, you reply with a smile. Other people underestimate you, you reply with your game," he said.
Athallah also touched on the struggle of Alfin Lestaluhu who had participated in passing the U-16 national team to the AFC U-16 2020 2020 in Bahrain. "Up and down for Indonesia. Indonesia is proud, Fin, all are proud," he said.
When Alfin was hospitalized, a group of the Indonesian National Team U-16 attended the charity match event held by the Indonesian Professional Players Association for Alfin on October 27, 2019. The event was held at the Serenia Hills Square, South Jakarta. The U-16 national team coach, the Milky Way accompanied by his assistants also attended and played in the exhibition game that featured APPI against HIPMI Jaya FC.
"Yes, this is a concern for our fellow players. Moreover, Alfin once fought with us in the AFC U-16 Cup qualification some time ago in Jakarta. We hope Alfin will recover soon and get fit quickly and be able to join us," said the Milky Way.
In the charity match some of the former Indonesian national team players were also present such as Kurniawan Dwi Yulianto, Nova Arianto, Hendro Kartiko, Syamsir Alam etc. The donation was immediately received by Alfin's parents who were present at this event.
Alfin Lestaluhu became one of the mainstays of the U-16 national team trained by the Milky Way. When appearing in the 2019 AFF U-15 Cup, this team won third place.
The football player dropped by Ragunan Sports Special School then appeared in the Group G match of the 2020 U-16 Asian Cup Qualification which took place in Jakarta, mid-September 2019. He scored one goal when Indonesia defeated the Philippines 4-0 in the first match. Indonesia also qualified for the U-16 2020 Asia Cup in Bahrain.
Alfin Lestaluhu is known to have been ill after he and his family became victims of the earthquake that rocked the surrounding Ambon Island on Thursday, September 26th. Alfin was in a refugee tent before being treated at the Ambon Army Hospital, Maluku, and then taken to Jakarta for further treatment.

IRSYAN HASYIM
